repository.corpname: Archives & Special Collections at the Thomas J. Dodd Research Center, University of Connecticut Libraries

did.abstract: Correspondence to Elizabeth Dennis from home while she attended college and law school.

bioghist.head: Biography
bioghist.p: Elizabeth Dennis Hutchins, daughter of Edward L. Dennis of Scotland, Connecticut, attended Connecticut State College [now the University of Connecticut] and graduated in 1936. After graduation, she attended the Hartford College of Law (later part of the University of Connecticut), receiving her J.D. degree in 1939.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: The Elizabeth Dennis Hutchins Papers consist of correspondence to Elizabeth from home while she was attending college and law school. The one-sided correspondence documents everyday activities, events and the lives of individuals in and around Scotland, Connecticut in the mid to late 1930s. The correspondence also alludes to student activities (studies, exams, dances, etc.) and appropriate student housing in Hartford, Connecticut.
The collection is foldered as it was received as only two items in the collection are dated. The folders are in no particular order.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Series I: Correspondence, ( undated, 1945-1936) consists of letters to Elizabeth from home.

userestrict.head: Restrictions on Use
userestrict.p: Permission to publish from these Papers must be obtained in writing from both the University of Connecticut Libraries and the owner(s) of the copyright.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Item description, #:#], Elizabeth Dennis Hutchins Papers. Archives & Special Collections at the Thomas J. Dodd Research Center, University of Connecticut Libraries.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: The collection was donated by Peter Baldwin in July 2005.

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: The collection is open and available for research.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Material
relatedmaterial.p: Archives & Special Collections has a substantial collection of materials pertaining to Connecticut history and the University. For detailed information on these collections please contact the curator or ask at the Reading Room desk.
